alert.note: Alert for Grainger; Hamblen; Jefferson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:32AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox, Jefferson, southwestern Grainger and west central Hamblen Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 931 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Plainview, or 10 miles northeast of Knoxville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Morristown, Jefferson City, Dandridge, Plainview, New Market, Strawberry Plains, Blaine, Panther Creek State Park and House Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
